snippet: Urging alternatives for economic growth, tens of thousands of demonstrators rallied in Spain, Britain, France, Greece, Germany and beyond.
abstract: European May Day celebrations take on a special resonance as thousands of demonstrators gather across the continent to protest enforced austerity measures and the growing gap between rich and poor. (M)1

byline.original: By ERIC PFANNER; Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens

lead_paragraph: PARIS -- The annual May Day demonstrations took on special resonance across Europe on Tuesday as tens of thousands of protesters turned out amid rising anger over enforced austerity that many see not as a cure to the region's fiscal troubles, but as a deterrent to economic growth and job creation. In Spain, trade unions estimated that more than one million people had protested in 80 cities, with the largest gatherings in Madrid and Barcelona. While organizers said 100,000 protesters had shown up in Barcelona, however, the police offered a starkly lower estimate of 15,000.

headline.main: Austerity Pain Fills Europe With Protests On May Day
